page.title: 04SUTTON LOWER SCHOOL
page.content: The school was built in 1870 by the Burgoyne family who,at that time,owned the village of Sutton.It is an attractive Victorian building featuring tall chimneys,a bell tower and some interesting decorative brickwork. A new extension was added in 1970 and oil-fired central heating was also installed.The front playground contains two large lime trees which add to the pleasing appearance of the building.At the rear of the school is a large field which is used by the children for play and sporting activities.There are 2 classrooms,a serving area for school meals,2 cloakrooms and an office. At present there are 27 children on roll with 2 teaching staff including the Headmistress.There are 2 part-time ancillary helpers and a caretaker.
